add_custom_content.description: Adds your custom posts and pages.
add_custom_content.label: Add Custom Content

allow_search_engines.description: Allow Google and other search engines to crawl your site by creating a virtual robots.txt url.
allow_search_engines.label: Allow search engines

show_exceptions.description: Shows Mod WP exception trace. Turn on only if you are debugging Mod WP (not WordPress)
show_exceptions.label: Show Exceptions

HTTP_HOST.description: e.g. example.com. The domain of your site. It is used to tell the command line what domain to use when generating the WordPress site and home urls. When you install by the web form, the install ignores this value and instead uses the predefined  $_SERVER['HTTP_HOST'] variable.
HTTP_HOST.label: Domain

install_dropin.description: Execute the install-dropin.php file in place, containing your customized version of WordPress's wp_install_default() function.
install_dropin.label: Install Dropin

max_execution_time.description: Maximum Execution Time allowed for a PHP script. Set this value to at least 300 if you are recieving installation failures due to timing issues.A value of 0 or less will cause the value in the php.ini to be used instead.
max_execution_time.label: Max Execution Time

move_wpconfig.description: This determines whether the `wp-config.php` file is moved to a separate 'config' directory that can be placed in the same directory as root (default) or, more securely, above the web root.
move_wpconfig.label: Move wp-config.php

plugins.description: Plugins to download and install from the WordPress plugins directory.
plugins.label: Plugins

profile.description: Select a profile, a collection of WordPress settings, plugins and themes that are grouped together in the profiles directory.
profile.label: Profile

reinstall.description: Forces the overwrite of the WordPress installation directory and database.
reinstall.label: Reinstall

remove_default_content.description: Remove WordPress's default  post ('Hello World', pages, and comments)
remove_default_content.label: Remove default content.

remove_default_themes.description: Remove all default themes except for that which is selected to become active.
remove_default_themes.label: Remove default themes.

remove_file_cruft.description: Remove license.txt and readme.txt and other non-essential files that are not required for WordPress functionality.
remove_file_cruft.label: Remove file cruft.

script_debug.description: Uses uncompressed version of javascript scripts for easier debugging.
script_debug.label: Script Debug

set_media_options.description: Apply thumbnail and image sizes and crop settings.
set_media_options.label: Set Media Options.

set_permissions.description: Attempt to set file permissions, locking down configuration files and preventing unauthorized access.
set_permissions.label: Set Permissions

slide_rule.description: Creates `_live` , `_stage`, and `_dev` `wp-config.php` files when used with the Slide Rule project
slide_rule.label: Slide Rule

wp_directory.description: The name of the directory to install WordPress. Leave empty to install in your web site's root.
wp_directory.label: WordPress Directory

blogdescription.description: A short description of your site that will appear beneath your blog name
blogdescription.label: Blog Description

large_size_h.description: The height in pixels of a large post image.
large_size_h.label: Large post image size (Height)

large_size_w.description: The width in pixels of a large post image.
large_size_w.label: Large post image size (Width)

medium_size_h.description: The height in pixels of a medium post image.
medium_size_h.label: Medium post image size (Height)

medium_size_w.description: The width in pixels of a medium post image.
medium_size_w.label: Medium post image size (Width)

permalink_structure.description: The permalink structure used for WordPress urls. Codex
permalink_structure.label: Permalink Structure

template.description: The WordPress theme to be selected upon installation. The theme must be available after wpInstallThemes  and remove_themes
template.label: Theme

thumbnail_crop.description: Crop mode. True = hard cropped from center. False, soft crop(resize). May also set as array, e.g: array('center','top') WordPress Cropping Guide
thumbnail_crop.label: Thumbnail Crop

thumbnail_size_h.description: The height in pixels of a post thumbnail.
thumbnail_size_h.label: Thumbnail Size (Height)

thumbnail_size_w.description: The width in pixels of a post thumbnail.
thumbnail_size_w.label: Thumbnail Size (Width)

DB_HOST.description: The hostname used by the database server.
DB_HOST.label: Database Host

DB_NAME.description: The name of the WordPress database.
DB_NAME.label: Database name

DB_USER.description: The username of the database user.
DB_USER.label: Database user

DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT.description: Disables file editing for theme and plugin files from within the Admin panels. Codex Reference
DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT.label: DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT

media.description: The name of the directory that receives uploads.
media.label: Upload directory name

WP_DEBUG.description: Controls the reporting of some errors and warnings and enables use of the WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY and WP_DEBUG_LOG settings. Codex Reference
WP_DEBUG.label: WP_DEBUG

WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY.description: Prints PHP errors to screen. Codex Reference
WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY.label: WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY

WP_DEBUG_LOG.description: Logs PHP errors to an debug.log to wp-content. Codex Reference
WP_DEBUG_LOG.label: WP_DEBUG_LOG

WPCOM_API_KEY.description: Your WordPress API key. Used for askimet, jetpack and other Automattic services. <a href="https://en.support.wordpress.com/api-keys/">Codex Reference</a
WPCOM_API_KEY.label: WPCOM_API_KEY

user_email.description: The WordPress admin user's email address
user_email.label: WordPress admin email address

wpDownload.description: Download the latest version of WordPress and extract it to the WordPress installation directory.
wpDownload.label: Install Switch - Download

wpConfig.description: Create wp-config.php files and update the wp-options table with site and profile settings.
wpConfig.label: Install Switch - Config

wpInstallCore.description: Install WordPress. Includes creating WordPress database tables and adding users
wpInstallCore.label: Install Switch - Core

wpInstallThemes.description: Install themes by copying over any directory or zip file from the Profile's 'themes' directory.
wpInstallThemes.label: Install Switch - Themes

wpInstallPlugins.description: Install plugins by copying over any directory or zip file from the Profile's 'plugins' directory, or as specified by $config[plugins] array.
wpInstallPlugins.label: Install Switch - Plugins

wpResetPassword.description: Reset the WordPress admin password for an existing installation.
wpResetPassword.label: Install Switch - ResetPassword
